Despite the severe internet restrictions, scenes of the heartbreaking and ruthless killing of protesters in various provinces are gradually being released by the media—an indication of an organized massacre, the dimensions of which are being progressively revealed. +
This catastrophe has created a deep and irreparable rift between the people of Iran and the ruling authorities.

Mawlana Abdolhamid At The Zahedan Friday Prayer Ceremony(January 9th, 2026):
The People Of Iran Have Taken To The Scene For “Major Changes”

The massacre of thousands of protesters in Tehran and other cities of our country over the course of several days was a horrific and unprecedented tragedy.
This bitter event has plunged the Iranian nation into grief and anger
+

and has deeply wounded the conscience of free-spirited people around the world.
There is no doubt that the masterminds and perpetrators of this crime are accountable in this world and will also deserve divine punishment in the Hereafter.

With condolences extended to the families of the recent victims, it is emphasized that any form of lethal violence against protesters constitutes a crime under international law and is, from a religious perspective, strictly forbidden (haram) and wholly unjustifiable.
